reviewText: Before you read this, hopefully you are well aware of the state of affairs in the USA as well as around the world, with immigration of hundreds of thousands of people of the Islam faith into countries that for the most part, had a huge minority of that faith based population prior to the last 20 or so years.  Hopefully you have been surfing the web and looking for information regarding how many cities in America are growing in Muslim population, which normally would not be an issue.  Being fair and balanced, and an intelligent American would ask "so what?  Equality if my motto".  This is all well and good for that person who knows nothing of what he is talking about.  When one truly understands the Koran and it's significance in the life of the Muslim, there certainly is room to wonder and worry, if you will.  The Koran is plain in its language regarding death to the infidels.  A devout Muslim will pray 5 times a day.  Do Christians?  I doubt it.  Are Christians as demonstrative of their religion during those 5 daily prayers?  That is, do they drop to their knees 5 times a day and pray?  I think not.  These devout Muslims take their religion much more seriously.  Who are the infidels?  Anyone who isn't a Muslim.  Their Koran tells them it is their duty to eventually take over the world and make the world practice their religion, or they die.  No exception.  This book explains how, quietly, Muslims are taught from a very young age, even here in America, how to perform Jihad in America.  Jihad, for those of you who do not know, is "holy war".  A war against infidels.  Mosques are where their children attend school are taught to read and understand the Koran, and part of their early education is the whats, hows and whens of Jihad.  You will be surprised to learn of the major Cities in America where a large portion of the population of that city is Muslim.  Do you have reason to fear?  That is not for me to decide.  But everyone needs to educate themselves regarding what is going on in the world around them

reviewText: I have to believe that the apathy our government shows to this great threat to our traditional way of life is planned.  Can we be so blind?  I guess history says, "Yes!"  Too bad!  I read Emerson's American Jihad, published in 2002, and here we are more than a decade later and people still haven't grasped just how insidious the threat really is.  Good video to own so that in another decade you can at least say, "the warnings were there."
